meanings.sent1: The children were preexcitingly waiting for the magician to start the show.
meanings.sent2: She always preexcites her friends with stories of her adventures.
meanings.sent3: The preexciting anticipation made the surprise party even more thrilling.
meanings.sent4: His preexciting energy was like a spark igniting the whole room.
meanings.sent5: The preexciting news spread quickly through the small town.

meanings.definition: To cause excitement before an event.
meanings.sent1: The coach preexcited the team with a motivational speech before the big game.
meanings.sent2: The upcoming concert is preexciting music fans all over the city.
meanings.sent3: The preexciting atmosphere in the stadium was electric.
meanings.sent4: Her preexciting words set the stage for a memorable evening.
meanings.sent5: The preexciting buzz in the air signaled something extraordinary was about to happen.

meanings.sent1: The preexciting students eagerly awaited the results of their exam.
meanings.sent2: The preexciting puppy wagged its tail in anticipation of a walk.
meanings.sent3: The preexciting chatter among the guests hinted at a surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The preexciting colors of the sunset painted the sky in hues of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The preexciting atmosphere of the carnival filled the children with joy.
